meanings.definition: A domestic fowl kept for its eggs or meat, especially a young one.
meanings.sent1: The farmer raised a chicken for fresh eggs every morning.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy eating grilled chicken with vegetables for dinner.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken sit on the remote control? It wanted to change the channel!
meanings.sent4: Her courage was as thin as a chicken's feather in the face of danger.
meanings.sent5: The fluffy yellow chick was the cutest chicken I had ever seen.

meanings.sent1: Don't be a chicken, face your fears head-on!
meanings.sent2: The chicken hesitated to speak up during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The chicken was too scared to cross the road, fearing the unknown.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a chicken hiding from challenges, always avoiding risks.
meanings.sent5: His friends teased him for being a chicken when it came to trying new things.

meanings.definition: A game in which the first person to lose their nerve and withdraw from a dangerous situation is the loser.
meanings.sent1: Let's play chicken and see who can hold on the longest.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends decided to play chicken by the cliff.
meanings.sent3: In the game of chicken, the bravest one stays till the end.
meanings.sent4: The ultimate test of courage was the game of chicken they played.
meanings.sent5: The game of chicken made their hearts race as they stared into the unknown.
